title: Extreme Lag (not my network problem)
body:
In game, my ping is usually 30~40 but every minute it jumps to 300~500.
It happens both the situations:
1. Using my Verizon cable wifi 
2. Using my AT&T 4G on cellphone (personal hotspot.)

It happedn last night and tonight.
It must be RIOT's problem.

Please look into it. Thanks.

replies.body:
We haven't been having any major server issues on NA recently, so this might actually be a case of some packet loss with the way that ping is randomly spiking so high. Packet loss happens when your connection leaves your network and is essentially when part of that connection gets lost along the way or damaged somehow. 

Let's run a quick test to check for that before we go too much further by using this [**log reader**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743). Grab some network logs from one of those laggy games and let the reader scan it. Grab a screenshot using something like Gyazo, and paste it here so that I can go over it with you!

Thank you for your reply. I got the log already, but where is the Log Reader??
Is it a software?
My bad! You can get to the log reader by clicking right here-> [**log reader**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743)

Your average ping was 42 milliseconds.

The worst ping you experienced was 260ms. This means you experienced high ping during this game, which is likely where you were seeing issues. See below for a few recommendations to help out with this.

Your average percentage of packet loss for this game was 3.93%.

Overall, this means you had a high amount of packets lost during the game. This can be caused by various network issues, so please see below for a few common steps that can help reduce packet loss.

Yeeeeep I was afraid of that. Typically packet loss originates from outside of your own network along the route that your ISP is sending your connection. 

It might be worth it to reach out to that ISP to make sure there aren't any current issues, but go ahead and reach out to our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with those network logs. They may be able to pick those apart and find some solution for you!

Thank you.
But I am emphosizing that using both my Verizon cable and AT&T 4G are having the problem.
It is impossible that both ISP are having problems.
It is most likely that your RIOT side server has issues.

That's understandable! It might be a possibility, but there simply haven't been any NA server outages recently, nor any current widespread issues that we've been seeing. You're always welcome to reach out to us in that ticket if you want further assistance ^_^!
